paper_abstract: A partial function F : Sigma* -> Omega* is called a simple function if F(w) is an element of Omega* is the output produced in the generation of a word omega is an element of Sigma* from a nonterminal of a simple context free grammar G with output alphabet Omega. In this paper we present an efficient algorithm for testing equivalence of simple functions. Such functions correspond also to one-state deterministic pushdown transducers. Our algorithm works in time polynomial with respect to vertical bar G vertical bar + v(G), where vertical bar G vertical bar is the size of the textual description of G, and v(G) is the maximum of the shortest lengths of words generated by nonterminals of G.
paper_title: Equivalence of functions represented by simple context-free grammars with output
